content:
I am a double major student and currently a senior undergraduate student at computer engineering department of Amirkabir University of Technology. I have recently finished my first bachelor degree in Physics from Amirkabir University of Technology with GPA of 3.78 /4.00 (17.85 /20) . Prior to that, I received my diploma in Mathematics & Physics from (NODET) Shahid Beheshti high school - 2014
My research interests include Algorithms, Complexity Theory, Graph Theory and Game Theory.
Recently, I am doing a research (click to see more) on graph sampling using different spanning trees such as minimum spanning tree, maximum spanning tree, low weighted and high weighted random walk spanning trees. I am also working on visualization of these graphs in terms of closeness centrality, betweenness centrality and ….

GRE subject Physics score: 830 /990 - September 2018
TOEFL iBT score (November 2, 2018): 95 /120 (Reading: 26, Listening 23, Speaking 24, Writing 22)

content:
Graph sampling from distance matrices using Spanning trees(minimum spanning tree, maximum spanning tree, low weighted and high weighted random walk spanning trees) and visualization of closeness centrality and betweenness centrality in these graphs.
The project was developed using some python libraries such as networkx, numpy and graphviz.
The main purpose of graph sampling is to construct smaller sub graph from large graph which is representative. A representative sample is one which preserve important properties of the graph. Graph sampling becomes more important when original Graph is massive. There is no perfect sample that can preserve all the properties of the original graph, so we should find the most appropriate one that can preserve the important properties for domain-specific goals.
I am currently working on this project and It is not completely finished yet.
summary: Graph sampling from distance matrices using Spanning trees and visualization of closeness and betweenness in graph
title: Graph Sampling Project
